definitions.definition: The act of moving slowly on hands and knees etc, or with frequent stops.
A rapid swimming stroke with alternate overarm strokes and a fluttering kick.
A very slow pace.
definitions.example: My computer has slowed down to a crawl since I installed that software package.

definitions.definition: A piece of horizontally or vertically scrolling text overlaid on the main image.
To creep; to move slowly on hands and knees, or by dragging the body along the ground.
definitions.example: Clutching my wounded side, I crawled back to the trench.

definitions.definition: To move forward slowly, with frequent stops.
definitions.example: The rush-hour traffic crawled around the bypass.

definitions.definition: To act in a servile manner.
definitions.example: Don't come crawling to me with your useless apologies!

definitions.definition: (with "with") See crawl with.
To feel a swarming sensation.
definitions.example: The horrible sight made my skin crawl.

definitions.definition: To swim using the crawl stroke.
definitions.example: I think I'll crawl the next hundred metres.

definitions.definition: To move over an area on hands and knees.
definitions.example: The baby crawled the entire second floor.

definitions.definition: To visit while becoming inebriated.
definitions.example: They crawled the downtown bars.

definitions.definition: To visit files or web sites in order to index them for searching.
definitions.example: Yahoo Search has updated its Slurp Crawler to crawl web sites faster and more efficiently.

definitions.definition: A pen or enclosure of stakes and hurdles for holding fish.
A performing engagement by a musical group; or, generally, any job or role, especially for a musician or performer.
definitions.example: Hey, when are we gonna get that hotel gig again?

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any job; especially one that is temporary; or alternately, one that is very desirable.
definitions.example: Hey, that guy's got a great gig over at the bike shop. He hardly works all day

definitions.definition: A forked spear for catching fish, frogs, or other small animals.
A two-wheeled horse-drawn carriage.
(South England) A six-oared sea rowing boat commonly found in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly.
An open boat used to transport the captain of a ship, the captain's gig.
A demerit received for some infraction of military dress or deportment codes.
definitions.example: I received gigs for having buttons undone.

definitions.definition: To fish or catch with a gig, or fish spear.
To engage in musical performances.
definitions.example: The Stones were gigging around Richmond at the time

definitions.definition: To make fun of; to make a joke at someone's expense, often condescending.
definitions.example: His older cousin was just gigging him about being in love with that girl from school.

definitions.definition: To impose a demerit for an infraction of a dress or deportment code.
definitions.example: His sergeant gigged him for an unmade bunk.

definitions.definition: Clipped form of gigabyte.
definitions.example: My new computer has over 500 gigs of hard drive space.

definitions.definition: Any unit having the SI prefix giga-
A playful or wanton girl; a giglot.
To engender.
A meeting or gathering.
definitions.example: The convention was held in Geneva.

definitions.definition: A formal deliberative assembly of mandated delegates.
definitions.example: The EU installed an inter-institutional Convention to draft a European constitution.

definitions.definition: The convening of a formal meeting.
A formal agreement, contract or pact.
A treaty or supplement to such.
definitions.example: The Vienna convention at the Vienna Congress (1814-15) standardized most of diplomatic conduct for generations.

definitions.definition: A practice or procedure widely observed in a group, especially to facilitate social interaction; a custom.
definitions.example: Table seatings are generally determined by tacit convention, not binding formal protocol.

definitions.definition: One who relies on another for support
definitions.example: With two children and an ailing mother, she had three dependents in all.

definitions.definition: (grammar) An element in phrase or clause structure that is not the head. Includes complements, modifiers and determiners.

(grammar) The aorist subjunctive or subjunctive perfective: a form of a verb not used independently but preceded by a particle to form the negative or a tense form. Found in Greek and in the Gaelic languages.
Relying upon; depending upon.
definitions.example: At that point I was dependent on financial aid for my tuition.

definitions.definition: Having a probability that is affected by the outcome of a separate event.
(of Scottish Gaelic, Manx and Irish verb forms) Used in questions, negative sentences and after certain particles and prepositions.
Affecting the lower part of the body, such as the legs while standing up, or the back while supine.
Hanging down.
definitions.example: a dependent bough or leaf

definitions.definition: The property of being effective, of achieving results.
definitions.example: The effectiveness of the drug was well established.

definitions.definition: The capacity or potential for achieving results.
The degree to which something achieves results.
definitions.example: He questioned the effectiveness of the treatment.

definitions.definition: Belief that there are distinct human races with inherent differences which determine their abilities, and generally that some are superior and others inferior.
The policies, practices, or systems (e.g. government or political) promoting this belief or promoting the dominance of one or more races over others.
definitions.example: Martin Luther King spoke out against racism.

definitions.definition: Prejudice or discrimination based upon race or ethnicity; an action of such discrimination.
An instance of inclining the head up and down, as to indicate agreement, or as a cursory greeting.
A reference or allusion to something.
A nomination.
definitions.example: For the fifth time in her career she received a Grammy nod, she has yet to win the award.

definitions.definition: Approval.
definitions.example: The plan is expected to get the nod from councillors at the next meeting.

definitions.definition: To incline the head up and down, as to indicate agreement.
To briefly incline the head downwards as a cursory greeting.
To sway, move up and down.
To gradually fall asleep.
To signify by a nod.
definitions.example: They nodded their assent.

definitions.definition: To make a mistake by being temporarily inattentive or tired
To head; to strike the ball with one's head.
definitions.example: Jones nods the ball back to his goalkeeper.

definitions.definition: To allude to something.
To fall asleep while under the influence of opiates.
To make worse; to make inferior in quality or value; to impair.
definitions.example: to deteriorate the mind

definitions.definition: To grow worse; to be impaired in quality; to degenerate.
Rite; a repeated set of actions
definitions.example: They carried out the ritual carefully.

definitions.definition: Related to a rite or repeated set of actions.
definitions.example: They performed the ritual lighting of the candles.

definitions.definition: The state or practice of being a sponsor.
definitions.example: I find that for me, my sponsorship of a child via a charitable NGO provides a sense of great satisfaction.

definitions.definition: The aid or support provided by a sponsor; backing or patronage.
definitions.example: The company provided sponsorship to the research team.

definitions.definition: An advance through and past enemy lines.
Any major progress; such as a great innovation or discovery that overcomes a significant obstacle.
definitions.example: Albert Einstein is credited with making some of the greatest breakthroughs in modern physics.

definitions.definition: The penetration of the opposition defence
The penetration of a separating wall or the remaining distance to an adjacent hollow (a crosscut in mining) or between two parts of a tunnel build from both ends; knockthrough.
Characterized by major progress or overcoming some obstacle.
definitions.example: a breakthrough technological advance

definitions.definition: A process of decision-making that seeks widespread agreement among group members.
General agreement among the members of a given group or community, each of which exercises some discretion in decision-making and follow-up action.
definitions.example: After years of debate over the best wine to serve at Thanksgiving, no real consensus has emerged.

definitions.definition: Average projected value.
definitions.example: a financial consensus forecast

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to psychology.
definitions.example: I'm concerned about their psychological well-being.

definitions.definition: Without an objective, or reasonably logical foundation.
definitions.example: Prices seem to have stopped rising, having hit the psychological ceiling of just under 100 dollars.

definitions.definition: One who founds or establishes (especially said of a company, project, organisation, state)
definitions.example: the founder of Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg

definitions.definition: Someone for whose parents one has no data.
The iron worker in charge of the blast furnace and the smelting operation.
One who casts metals in various forms; a caster.
definitions.example: a founder of cannon, bells, hardware, or printing types

definitions.definition: A severe laminitis of a horse, caused by untreated internal inflammation in the hooves.
Of a ship, to fill with water and sink.
To fall; to stumble and go lame, as a horse.
To fail; to miscarry.
To cause to fill and sink, as a ship.
To disable or lame (a horse) by causing internal inflammation and soreness in the feet or limbs.
The act or process of (physically or figuratively) attaching.
A strong bonding with or fondness for someone or something.
definitions.example: I have such an attachment towards my fiancé!

definitions.definition: A dependence, especially a strong one.
A device attached to a piece of equipment or a tool.
The means by which something is physically attached.
A file sent along with an email.
Taking a person's property to satisfy a court-ordered debt.

definitions.definition: The act or process by which any (downward) leader connects to any available (upward) streamer in a lightning flash.
definitions.example: 2009, Jakke Mäkelä, Eero Karvinen, Niko Porjo, Antti Mäkelä and Tapio Tuomi, Attachment of Natural Lightning Flashes to Trees: Preliminary Statistical Characteristics, published in the Journal of Lightning Research, volume 1

definitions.definition: A length of thread, line or rope that is doubled over to make an opening.
The opening so formed.
A shape produced by a curve that bends around and crosses itself.
definitions.example: Arches, loops, and whorls are patterns found in fingerprints.

definitions.definition: A ring road or beltway.
An endless strip of tape or film allowing continuous repetition.
A complete circuit for an electric current.
A programmed sequence of instructions that is repeated until or while a particular condition is satisfied.
An edge that begins and ends on the same vertex.
A path that starts and ends at the same point.
A bus or rail route, walking route, etc. that starts and ends at the same point.
A place at a terminus where trains or trams can turn round and go back the other way without having to reverse; a balloon loop, turning loop, or reversing loop.
A quasigroup with an identity element.
A loop-shaped intrauterine device.
An aerobatic maneuver in which an aircraft flies a circular path in a vertical plane.
A small, narrow opening; a loophole.
A flexible region in a protein's secondary structure.
A mass of iron in a pasty condition gathered into a ball for the tilt hammer or rolls.
To form something into a loop.
To fasten or encircle something with a loop.
To fly an aircraft in a loop.
To move something in a loop.
To join electrical components to complete a circuit.
To duplicate the route of a pipeline.
To create an error in a computer program so that it runs in an endless loop and the computer freezes up.
To form a loop.
To move in a loop.
definitions.example: The program loops until the user presses a key.

definitions.definition: The study and use of electrical devices that operate by controlling the flow of electrons or other electrically charged particles or by converting the flow of charged particles to or from other forms of energy.
definitions.example: Electronics is a popular subject.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A device or devices which require the flow of electrons through conductors and semiconductors in order to perform their function; devices that operate on electrical power (battery or outlet)
Electronic circuitry.
definitions.example: The electronics are completely updated.

definitions.definition: One who protests, either singly or in a public display of group feeling.
definitions.example: The protesters thronged Trafalgar Square and sang anti-war songs.

definitions.definition: One who protests a bill of exchange, or note.
To filter by passing through a screen.
definitions.example: Mary screened the beans to remove the clumps of gravel.

definitions.definition: To shelter or conceal.
To remove information, or censor intellectual material from viewing.
definitions.example: The news report was screened because it accused the politician of wrongdoing.

definitions.definition: To present publicly (on the screen).
definitions.example: The news report will be screened at 11:00 tonight.

definitions.definition: To fit with a screen.
definitions.example: We need to screen this porch. These bugs are driving me crazy.

definitions.definition: To examine patients or treat a sample in order to detect a chemical or a disease, or to assess susceptibility to a disease.
To search chemical libraries by means of a computational technique in order to identify chemical compounds which would potentially bind to a given biological target such as a protein.
To stand so as to block a defender from reaching a teammate.
To determine the source or subject matter of a call before deciding whether to answer the phone.
Mesh material that is used to screen (as in a "screen door").
definitions.example: I'll have to buy some screening and fix the doors before mosquito season starts.

definitions.definition: The process of checking or filtering.
definitions.example: The airports are slow now because the pre-boarding screening is so inefficient.

definitions.definition: The showing of a film
The examination and treatment of a material to detect and remove unwanted fractions
(in the plural) Material removed by such a process; refuse left after screening sand, coal, ashes, etc.
Shielding
A method to identify a disease in a population which is not showing any symptoms of this disease.
Action done by the serving team to prevent the opposing team from seeing the server and the flight path of the ball.
To dictate policy.
To control or direct according to rule, principle, or law.
To adjust to a particular specification or requirement: regulate temperature.
To adjust (a mechanism) for accurate and proper functioning.
definitions.example: to regulate a watch, i.e. adjust its rate of running so that it will keep approximately standard time

definitions.definition: To put or maintain in order.
definitions.example: to regulate one's eating habits

definitions.definition: Well grounded or justifiable, pertinent.
definitions.example: I will believe him as soon as he offers a valid answer.

definitions.definition: Acceptable, proper or correct; in accordance with the rules.
definitions.example: A valid format for the date is MM/DD/YY.

definitions.definition: Related to the current topic, or presented within context, relevant.
Of a formula or system: such that it evaluates to true regardless of the input values.
Of an argument: whose conclusion is always true whenever its premises are true.
definitions.example: An argument is valid if and only if the set consisting of both (1) all of its premises and (2) the contradictory of its conclusion is inconsistent.

definitions.definition: Effective.
definitions.example: He is a priest now: although his ordination was contrary to the law of the church, it was still valid.

definitions.definition: A method of detecting distant objects and determining their position, velocity, or other characteristics by analysis of sent radio waves (usually microwaves) reflected from their surfaces
A type of system using such method, differentiated by platform, configuration, frequency, power, and other technical attributes.
An installation of such a system or of the transmitting and receiving apparatus.
A superior ability to detect something.
definitions.example: His sensitive radar for hidden alliances keeps him out of trouble.

definitions.definition: To scan with radar, or as if with radar.
A person who subscribes to a publication or a service
definitions.example: Our magazine has over ten thousand subscribers.

definitions.definition: A person who resists an established authority, often violently
A person from the Confederate States of America
To resist or become defiant toward an authority.
A blood vessel that transports blood from the capillaries back to the heart.
(in plural) The entrails of a shrimp.
In leaves, a thickened portion of the leaf containing the vascular bundle.
The nervure of an insect’s wing.
A stripe or streak of a different colour or composition in materials such as wood, cheese, marble or other rocks.
A topic of discussion; a train of association, thoughts, emotions, etc.

definitions.definition: A style, tendency, or quality.
definitions.example: The play is in a satirical vein.

definitions.definition: A fissure, cleft or cavity, as in the earth or other substance.
To mark with veins or a vein-like pattern.
The state of being dependent, of relying upon another.
definitions.example: He had a deep dependence on her for guidance.

definitions.definition: An irresistible physical or psychological need, especially for a chemical substance.
definitions.example: Her dependence on cocaine led to her ruin.

definitions.definition: Words or a formula supposed to have magical powers.
definitions.example: He cast a spell to cure warts.

definitions.definition: A magical effect or influence induced by an incantation or formula.
definitions.example: under a spell

definitions.definition: Speech, discourse.
To put under the influence of a spell; to affect by a spell; to bewitch; to fascinate; to charm.
To read (something) as though letter by letter; to peruse slowly or with effort.
(sometimes with “out”) To write or say the letters that form a word or part of a word.
To be able to write or say the letters that form words.
definitions.example: I find it difficult to spell because I'm dyslexic.

definitions.definition: Of letters: to compose (a word).
definitions.example: The letters “a”, “n” and “d” spell “and”.

definitions.definition: (with “out”) To clarify; to explain in detail.
definitions.example: Please spell it out for me.

definitions.definition: To indicate that (some event) will occur.
definitions.example: This spells trouble.

definitions.definition: To constitute; to measure.
To speak, to declaim.
To tell; to relate; to teach.
A shift (of work); a set of workers responsible for a specific turn of labour.
A definite period (of work or other activity).
An indefinite period of time (usually with a qualifier); by extension, a relatively short distance.
A period of rest; time off.
A period of illness, or sudden interval of bad spirits, disease etc.
An uninterrupted series of alternate overs bowled by a single bowler.
To work in place of (someone).

definitions.definition: To rest (someone or something), to give someone or something a rest or break.
definitions.example: They spelled the horses and rested in the shade of some trees near a brook.

definitions.definition: To rest from work for a time.
A splinter, usually of wood; a spelk.
The wooden bat in the game of trap ball, or knurr and spell.
The act of prosecuting a scheme or endeavor.

definitions.definition: The institution of legal proceedings (particularly criminal) against a person.
The prosecuting party.
A fragment of anything shattered.

definitions.definition: A (pine) needle.
A form of concentrated cannabis.
To violently break something into pieces.

definitions.definition: To destroy or disable something.
To smash, or break into tiny pieces.
To dispirit or emotionally defeat

definitions.definition: To scatter about.
Form of a word with a stronger or more forceful sense than the root on which the intensive is built.
Thorough; to a great degree; with intensity.
Demanding; requiring a great amount of work etc.
definitions.example: This job is difficult because it is so labour-intensive.

definitions.definition: Highly concentrated.

definitions.definition: Stretched; allowing intension, or increase of degree; that can be intensified.
Characterized by persistence; intent; assiduous.
(grammar) Serving to give force or emphasis.

definitions.definition: Related to the need to manage life-threatening conditions by means of sophisticated life support and monitoring.
definitions.example: She was moved to the intensive-care unit of the hospital.

definitions.definition: An eruption; the sudden appearance of a rash, disease, etc.

definitions.definition: An outburst or sudden eruption, especially of violence and mischief.

definitions.definition: A sudden increase.

definitions.definition: A geological layer that breaks out.
To burst out.
To break forth.
A religious discourse.
To give a sermon.

To advise or recommend earnestly.
To teach or instruct by preaching; to inform by preaching.
To give advice in an offensive or obtrusive manner.
Something which clips or grasps; a device for attaching one object to another.

A frame containing a number of bullets which is intended to be inserted into the magazine of a firearm to allow for rapid reloading.

To fasten with a clip.

definitions.definition: The condition of something, its state.

To strike with the hand.

definitions.definition: To hit or strike, especially in passing.

To cut off a signal level at a certain maximum value.
To discard (an occluded part of a model or scene) rather than waste resources on rendering it.

An act of stroking (moving one's hand over a surface).

definitions.definition: A blow or hit.

definitions.definition: A single movement with a tool.

definitions.definition: A line drawn with a pen or other writing implement, particularly:

Power; influence.

To set, fix or determine (a time or place for something such as a meeting, or the meeting itself) by authority or agreement.

The action of intervening; interfering in some course of events.

An orchestrated attempt to convince somebody with an addiction or other psychological problem to seek professional help and/or change their behavior.
An action taken or procedure performed; an operation.

The use of a word or phrase to refer to something that it is not, invoking a direct similarity between the word or phrase used and the thing described (but in the case of English without the words like or as, since use of those words would imply a simile); the word or phrase used in this way; an implied comparison.

definitions.definition: To use a metaphor.
To describe by means of a metaphor.
(grammar) A construction showing a relative quality, in English usually formed by adding more or appending -er. For example, the comparative of green is greener; of evil, more evil.
(grammar) A word in the comparative form.
(chiefly in the plural) Data used to make a comparison.
An equal; a rival; a compeer.
One who makes comparisons; one who affects wit.
Of or relating to comparison.
Using comparison as a method of study, or founded on something using it.

Comparable; bearing comparison.
The ability to move; capacity for movement.

A worthless person, particularly:

The larger nonconformist social movement associated with punk rock and its fans.
To pimp.

Worthless, contemptible, particularly
Of or concerning punk rock or its associated subculture.

The entirety of means whereby a specific production is made existent or task accomplished.
A complex machine or instrument.
An assortment of tools and instruments.
A bureaucratic organization, especially one influenced by political patronage.
A vehicle used for emergency response.
Any of the equipment on which the gymnasts perform their movements.
A complex, highly modified weapon (typically not a firearm); a weaponized “Rube Goldberg machine.”
The act or process of making whole or entire.
(society) The process of fitting into a community, notably applied to minorities.
The operation of finding the integral of a function.
In evolution, the process by which the manifold is compacted into the relatively simple and permanent; supposed to alternate with differentiation as an agent in species' development.
The combination with compatible elements in order to incorporate them.
The process of countering racial segregation.
Care, kind concern, regard.
The inner flight muscle (pectoralis minor) of poultry.
Sensitive or painful to the touch.
Easily bruised or injured; not firm or hard; delicate.

definitions.definition: Physically weak; not able to endure hardship.
(of food) Soft and easily chewed.
Sensible to impression and pain; easily pained.
Fond, loving, gentle, sweet.
definitions.example: Suzanne was such a tender mother to her children.

definitions.definition: Young and inexperienced.
Adapted to excite feeling or sympathy; expressive of the softer passions; pathetic.
definitions.example: tender expressions; tender expostulations; a tender strain

definitions.definition: Apt to give pain; causing grief or pain; delicate.
definitions.example: a tender subject

definitions.definition: Heeling over too easily when under sail; said of a vessel.
Exciting kind concern; dear; precious.
Careful to keep inviolate, or not to injure; used with of.
Tenderly
To make tender or delicate; to weaken.
To feel tenderly towards; to regard fondly or with consideration.
Someone who tends or waits on someone.
A railroad car towed behind a steam engine to carry fuel and water.
A naval ship that functions as a mobile base for other ships.
definitions.example: destroyer tender

definitions.definition: A smaller boat used for transportation between a large ship and the shore.
To work on a tender.
Anything which is offered, proffered, put forth or bid with the expectation of a response, answer, or reply.

definitions.definition: A means of payment such as a check or cheque, cash or credit card.

definitions.definition: A formal offer to buy or sell something.
definitions.example: We will submit our tender to you within the week.

definitions.definition: Any offer or proposal made for acceptance.
To offer, to give.

definitions.definition: To offer a payment, as at sales or auctions.
A group of individuals chosen from the general population to hear and decide a case in a court of law.
A group of judges in a competition.
The audience attending the first night of a performance, whose reaction may determine whether it succeeds or fails.
To judge by means of a jury.
For temporary use; applied to a temporary contrivance.

definitions.definition: To keep someone from proceeding by holding them back or making claims on their attention.
To put under custody.
To keep back or from; to withhold.
To seize goods for official purposes.
The act of legislating; preparation and enactment of laws; the laws enacted.
Law which has been enacted by legislature or other governing body
Any of various evergreen trees from the family Palmae or Arecaceae, which are mainly found in the tropics.
A branch or leaf of the palm, anciently borne or worn as a symbol of victory or rejoicing.
(by extension) Triumph; victory.
Any of 23 awards that can be earned after obtaining the Eagle Scout rank, but generally only before turning 18 years old.
The inner and somewhat concave part of the human hand that extends from the wrist to the bases of the fingers.
The corresponding part of the forefoot of a lower mammal.
A linear measure equal either to the breadth of the hand or to its length from the wrist to the ends of the fingers; a hand; used in measuring a horse's height.
(sailmaking) A metallic disk attached to a strap and worn in the palm of the hand; used to push the needle through the canvas, in sewing sails, etc.
The broad flattened part of an antler, as of a full-grown fallow deer; so called as resembling the palm of the hand with its protruding fingers.
The flat inner face of an anchor fluke.
To hold or conceal something in the palm of the hand, e.g, for an act of sleight of hand or to steal something.
To hold something without bending the fingers significantly.

definitions.definition: To move something with the palm of the hand.
The act of signing up or registering for something.

definitions.definition: That which registers or makes something official, e.g. the form or paper that registers.
definitions.example: Did you submit your car registration yet?

definitions.definition: Alignment, e.g. of colors or other elements in a printing process.
The location where guests register, especially with a hotel.

definitions.definition: The art of selecting and combining the stops or registers of an organ.
To express one’s sympathetic pleasure or joy to the person(s) it is felt for.

definitions.definition: To consider oneself fortunate in some matter.

definitions.definition: The act of consulting.
A conference for the exchange of information and advice.
An appointment or meeting with a professional person, such as a doctor.
The shooting forth of anything from a point or surface, like diverging rays of light.

definitions.definition: The process of radiating waves or particles.
The transfer of energy via radiation (as opposed to convection or conduction).
Radioactive energy.
A piece of music for one performer.
A job or performance done by one person alone.
(games) A card game similar to whist in which each player plays against the others in turn without a partner
A single shot of espresso.
An instance of soloing the football.
To perform a solo.
To perform something in the absence of anyone else.
To drop the ball and then toe-kick it upward into the hands.
Without a companion or instructor.
Of, or relating to, a musical solo.
Alone, without a companion.
A sudden impact or blow.
The shock and noise produced by violently closing a door or other object.
A slam dunk.
An insult.

definitions.definition: The yellow iron silicate produced in alum works as a waste product.
A poetry slam.
A slambook.
The refuse of alum works.
A subgenre of death metal with elements of hardcore punk focusing on midtempo rhythms, breakdowns and palm-muted riffs
To shut with sudden force so as to produce a shock and noise.
definitions.example: Don't slam the door!

definitions.definition: To put in or on a particular place with force and loud noise. (Often followed by a preposition such as down, against or into.)
definitions.example: Don't slam that trunk down on the pavement!

definitions.definition: To strike forcefully with some implement.
To strike against suddenly and heavily.
definitions.example: The boat slammed into the bank and we were almost thrown into the river.

definitions.definition: To speak badly of; to criticize forcefully.
definitions.example: Critics slammed the new film, calling it violent and meaningless.

definitions.definition: To dunk forcefully, to slam dunk.
To make a slam bid.
To defeat (opponents at cards) by winning all the tricks of a deal or a hand.
To change providers (e.g. of domain registration or telephone carrier) for a customer without clear (if any) consent.
To drink off, to drink quickly.
To compete in a poetry slam.
To inject intravenously; shoot up.
A type of card game, also called ruff and honours.
A card game, played all at once without separate turns, in which players attempt to get rid of their cards as quickly as possible according to certain rules.
Losing or winning all the tricks in a game.
A bid of six (small slam) or seven (grand slam) in a suit or no trump.
Winning all (or all but one) of the available, major or specified events in a given year or sports season.
To defeat by winning all the tricks of a deal or a hand.
A shambling fellow.
To strengthen, especially by addition or augmentation.

definitions.definition: To emphasize or review.

definitions.definition: To encourage (a behavior or idea) through repeated stimulus.
definitions.example: Advertising for fast food can reinforce unhealthy dietary tendencies.

definitions.definition: To commit to (some action or outcome), or to assure (a person) of such commitment; to make an oath or vow.
definitions.example: He promised to never return to this town again.

definitions.definition: To give grounds for expectation, especially of something good.

definitions.definition: The act of making a promise.
Showing promise, and likely to develop in a desirable fashion.

definitions.definition: Encouraging and inspiring confidence.
A leaping, jumping or skipping movement.
The act of passing over an interval from one thing to another; an omission of a part.
A passage from one sound to another by more than a degree at once.
A person who attempts to disappear so as not to be found.
Skywave propagation
To move by hopping on alternate feet.

definitions.definition: To leap about lightly.
To skim, ricochet or bounce over a surface.

definitions.definition: To throw (something), making it skim, ricochet, or bounce over a surface.

definitions.definition: To disregard, miss or omit part of a continuation (some item or stage).

definitions.definition: To place an item in a skip.
Not to attend (some event, especially a class or a meeting).

definitions.definition: To leave, especially in a sudden and covert manner.

definitions.definition: To leap lightly over.

definitions.definition: (crocheting) To pass by a stitch as if it were not there, continuing with the next stitch.

A skep, or basket.
A wheeled basket used in cotton factories.

A beehive.
Short for skipper, the master or captain of a ship, or other person in authority.
(specially) The captain of a sports team. Also, a form of address by the team to the captain.
The player who calls the shots and traditionally throws the last two rocks.
(bowls) The captain of a bowls team, who directs the team's tactics and rolls the side's last wood, so as to be able to retrieve a difficult situation if necessary.
The scoutmaster of a troop of scouts (youth organization) and their form of address to him.
An Australian of Anglo-Celtic descent.

The act of conceiving.
The state of being conceived; the beginning.
The fertilization of an ovum by a sperm to form a zygote.
The start of pregnancy.
The formation of a conceptus or an implanted embryo.
The power or faculty of apprehending of forming an idea in the mind; the power of recalling a past sensation or perception; the ability to form mental abstractions.
An image, idea, or notion formed in the mind; a concept, plan or design.
Proceeding in a straight course or manner; not deviating.
Easy, simple, without difficulty
Direct; honest; frank
In a straightforward manner; straightforwards; straightforwardly.
The act of congregating or collecting together.

A gathering of faithful in a temple, church, synagogue, mosque or other place of worship. It can also refer to the people who are present at a devotional service in the building, particularly in contrast to the pastor, minister, imam, rabbi etc. and/or choir, who may be seated apart from the general congregation or lead the service (notably in responsory form).
A Roman Congregation, a main department of the Vatican administration of the Catholic Church.
A corporate body whose members gather for worship, or the members of such a body.
Any large gathering of people.
A group of eagles.
(Oxford University) The main body of university staff, comprising academics, administrative staff, heads of colleges, etc.
To satisfy, carry out, bring to completion (an obligation, a requirement, etc.).

definitions.definition: To emotionally or artistically satisfy; to develop one's gifts to the fullest.

definitions.definition: To obey, follow, comply with (a rule, requirement etc.).

definitions.definition: To package, distribute, or ship goods.
To fill full; fill to the utmost capacity; fill up.

definitions.definition: A conduit allowing liquid to flow out of an otherwise contained volume; a plughole (UK)

An outhole.
A drink.
To lose liquid.

definitions.definition: To flow gradually.

definitions.definition: To deplete of energy or resources.

definitions.definition: To draw off by degrees; to cause to flow gradually out or off; hence, to exhaust.
To filter.
To fall off the bottom of the playfield.
Evincing strength and health; strong.

definitions.definition: Violent; rough; rude.
Requiring strength or vigor

definitions.definition: Sensible (of intellect etc.); straightforward, not given to or confused by uncertainty or subtlety

Resistant or impervious to failure regardless of user input or unexpected conditions.
Not greatly influenced by errors in assumptions about the distribution of sample errors.
A catch phrase associated with the product or service being advertised.
A distinctive phrase of a person or group of people.
A battle cry among the ancient highlanders of Scotland.
The place where water, air or other fluid is taken into a pipe or conduit; opposed to outlet.

definitions.definition: A tract of land enclosed.
Any kind of cheat or imposition; the act of taking someone in.
To take in or draw in; to bring in from outside.
A set of principles of right and wrong behaviour guiding, or representative of, a specific culture, society, group, or individual.

Moral, relating to morals.

definitions.definition: Lacking concealing elements.

definitions.definition: Immature or unripe.
(grammar) Pertaining to the uninflected stem of a word.

To perform, display or exhibit for the first time.

definitions.definition: To govern in the role of premier.
Foremost; first or highest in quality or degree.
Most ancient.
A major appendage of human or animal, used for locomotion (such as an arm, leg or wing).
A branch of a tree.
The part of the bow, from the handle to the tip.
An elementary piece of the mechanism of a lock.
A thing or person regarded as a part or member of, or attachment to, something else.
The part of a corolla beyond the throat.
To remove the limbs from (an animal or tree).

definitions.definition: To supply with limbs.

The border or upper spreading part of a monopetalous corolla, or of a petal or sepal; blade.

To accomplish, to fulfil.

definitions.definition: A small, barely detectable amount of.
definitions.example: I could taste a hint of lemon in the wine.

definitions.definition: Information in a computer-based font that suggests how the outlines of the font's glyphs should be distorted in order to produce, at specific sizes, a visually appealing pixel-based rendering. Also known as hinting.
definitions.example: This font does not scale well; at small point sizes it has no hinting at all, and the hints that it has for the 10- and 12-point letter 'g' still need work.

definitions.definition: An opportunity; occasion; fit time.
To suggest tacitly without a direct statement; to provide a clue.
definitions.example: She hinted at the possibility of a recount of the votes.

definitions.definition: To bring to mind by a slight mention or remote allusion; to suggest in an indirect manner.
definitions.example: to hint a suspicion

definitions.definition: To develop and add hints to a font.
definitions.example: The typographer worked all day on hinting her new font so it would look good on computer screens.

definitions.definition: A worker who is only working for a company occasionally, not as its permanent employee.
A soldier temporarily at a place of duty, usually en route to another place of duty.
A member of a group of football hooligans who wear expensive designer clothing to avoid police attention; see casual (subculture).
One who receives relief for a night in a parish to which he does not belong; a vagrant.
A player of casual games.

definitions.definition: A person whose engagement with media is relaxed or superficial.
A tramp.
Happening by chance.

definitions.definition: Coming without regularity; occasional or incidental.
definitions.example: The purchase of donuts was just a casual expense.

definitions.definition: Employed irregularly.

definitions.definition: Careless.
Happening or coming to pass without design.
Informal, relaxed.
Designed for informal or everyday use.
To move slowly with the abdomen close to the ground.
Of plants, to grow across a surface rather than upwards.
To move slowly and quietly in a particular direction.
To make small gradual changes, usually in a particular direction.
To move in a stealthy or secret manner; to move imperceptibly or clandestinely; to steal in; to insinuate itself or oneself.
To slip, or to become slightly displaced.
To move or behave with servility or exaggerated humility; to fawn.
To have a sensation as of insects creeping on the skin of the body; to crawl.

The movement of something that creeps (like worms or snails)
A relatively small gradual change, variation or deviation (from a planned value) in a measure.
A slight displacement of an object: the slight movement of something
The gradual expansion or proliferation of something beyond its original goals or boundaries, considered negatively.

definitions.definition: In sewn books, the tendency of pages on the inside of a quire to stand out farther than those on the outside of it.
An increase in strain with time; the gradual flow or deformation of a material under stress.
The imperceptible downslope movement of surface rock.
Someone unpleasantly strange or eccentric.
A frightening and/or disconcerting person, especially one who gives the speaker chills.

definitions.definition: A barrier with small openings used to keep large animals out while allowing smaller animals to pass through.
An individual instance that represents a class; an example.

definitions.definition: A sample, especially one used for diagnostic analysis.
(often preceded with “fine”) An eligible man.
A concerted set of messages aimed at influencing the opinions or behavior of large numbers of people.
To give advice, especially professional advice, to (somebody).

definitions.definition: To recommend (a course of action).
definitions.example: I would counsel prudence in this matter.

definitions.definition: Assistance (especially from a professional) in the resolution of personal difficulties.
An event that appears inexplicable by the laws of nature and so is held to be supernatural in origin.

definitions.definition: A fortunate outcome that prevails despite overwhelming odds against it.
An awesome and exceptional example of something
To affect by a miracle; to work a miracle upon.
An umpire or judge; an official who makes sure the rules are followed during a game.

definitions.definition: A person who settles a dispute.
A person who writes a letter of reference or provides a reference by phone call for someone.

definitions.definition: An expert who judges the manuscript of an article or book to decide if it should be published.
To act as a referee.
definitions.example: He has to referee three hockey games this weekend.

definitions.definition: (also dairy products or dairy produce) Products produced from milk.
A place, often on a farm, where milk is processed and turned into products such as butter and cheese.
A dairy farm.
A shop selling dairy products.
A corner store, superette or minimart.
(chiefly in the plural) A woman's breast.
Referring to products produced from milk.
Referring to the milk production and processing industries.
On food labelling, containing fats only from dairy sources (e.g. dairy ice cream).
Anything, as goods, etc., taken or got by violence; anything taken by force from an enemy in war
That which is or may be seized by animals or birds to be devoured; hence, a person given up as a victim.
A living thing that is eaten by another living thing.

definitions.definition: The act of devouring other creatures; ravage.
The victim of a disease.
To act as a predator.
(usually groceries) retail foodstuffs and other household supplies.
A shop or store that sells groceries; a grocery store.
To go grocery shopping.
To furnish with groceries.
An embedded reporter or journalist, such as a war reporter assigned to and travelling with a military unit, or a political reporter assigned to follow and report on the campaign of a candidate.
An element of an advertisement, etc. serving as a subliminal message.
An item embedded in another document.
To lay as in a bed; to lay in surrounding matter; to bed.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To include in surrounding matter.
definitions.example: We wanted to embed our reporter with the Fifth Infantry Division, but the Army would have none of it.

definitions.definition: To encapsulate within another document or data file.
definitions.example: The instructions showed how to embed a chart from the spreadsheet within the wordprocessor document.

definitions.definition: To define a one-to-one function from (one set) to another so that certain properties of the domain are preserved when considering the image as a subset of the codomain.
That which is peculiar; a sole or exclusive property; a prerogative; a characteristic.
(canon law) an ecclesiastical district, parish, chapel or church outside the jurisdiction of the bishop of the diocese in which it is situated.
Out of the ordinary; odd; strange; unusual.
definitions.example: It would be rather peculiar to see a kangaroo hopping down a city street.

definitions.definition: Common or usual for a certain place or circumstance; specific or particular.
definitions.example: Kangaroos are peculiar to Australia.

definitions.definition: One's own; belonging solely or especially to an individual; not shared or possessed by others.
Particular; individual; special; appropriate.
To lead by persuasion or influence; incite or prevail upon.
To cause, bring about, lead to.
definitions.example: His meditation induced a compromise.   Opium induces sleep.

definitions.definition: To cause or produce (electric current or a magnetic state) by a physical process of induction.
To infer by induction.
To lead in, bring in, introduce.
To draw on, place upon.
To sadden or displease (someone) by underperforming, or by not delivering something promised or hoped for.
definitions.example: His lack of respect disappointed her.

definitions.definition: To deprive (someone of something expected or hoped for).
To fail to meet (an expectation); to fail to fulfil (a hope).
To show (an opinion, belief, etc.) to be mistaken.
To prevent (something planned or attempted).
Disappointed
An article in a publication giving the opinion of its editors on a given topic or current event.
A similar commentary on radio or television.
Of or relating to an editor, editing or an editorial.

definitions.definition: Appropriate for high fashion magazines.
A person who has the acute form of a disorder, such as schizophrenia.
An accent or tone higher than others.
An acute accent (´).
definitions.example: The word ‘cafe’ often has an acute over the ‘e’.

definitions.definition: To give an acute sound to.
definitions.example: He acutes his rising inflection too much.

definitions.definition: To make acute; to sharpen, to whet.
Brief, quick, short.
definitions.example: It was an acute event.

definitions.definition: High or shrill.
definitions.example: an acute accent or tone

definitions.definition: Intense, sensitive, sharp.
definitions.example: She had an acute sense of honour.  Eagles have very acute vision.

definitions.definition: Urgent.
definitions.example: His need for medical attention was acute.

definitions.definition: With the sides meeting directly to form an acute angle (at an apex or base).
Of an angle: less than 90 degrees.
definitions.example: The teacher pointed out the acute angle.

definitions.definition: Of a triangle: having all three interior angles measuring less than 90 degrees.
definitions.example: an acute triangle

definitions.definition: Of an accent or tone: generally higher than others.
Of an abnormal condition of recent or sudden onset, in contrast to delayed onset; this sense does not imply severity, unlike the common usage.
definitions.example: He dropped dead of an acute illness.

definitions.definition: Of a short-lived condition, in contrast to a chronic condition; this sense also does not imply severity.
definitions.example: The acute symptoms resolved promptly.

definitions.definition: After a letter of the alphabet: having an acute accent.
definitions.example: The last letter of ‘café’ is ‘e’ acute.

definitions.definition: A hardened rectangular block of mud, clay etc., used for building.

definitions.definition: Such hardened mud, clay, etc. considered collectively, as a building material.
definitions.example: This house is made of brick.

definitions.definition: Something shaped like a brick.
definitions.example: a plastic explosive brick

definitions.definition: A helpful and reliable person.
definitions.example: Thanks for helping me wash the car. You're a brick.

definitions.definition: A shot which misses, particularly one which bounces directly out of the basket because of a too-flat trajectory, as if the ball were a heavier object.
definitions.example: We can't win if we keep throwing up bricks from three-point land.

definitions.definition: A power brick; an external power supply consisting of a small box with an integral male power plug and an attached electric cord terminating in another power plug.
An electronic device, especially a heavy box-shaped one, that has become non-functional or obsolete.
A carton of 500 rimfire cartridges, which forms the approximate size and shape of a brick.
A community card (usually the turn or the river) which does not improve a player's hand.
definitions.example: The two of clubs was a complete brick on the river.

definitions.definition: The colour brick red.
One kilo of cocaine.
To build with bricks.
To make into bricks.
To hit someone or something with a brick.
To make an electronic device nonfunctional and usually beyond repair, essentially making it no more useful than a brick.
definitions.example: My VCR was bricked during the lightning storm.

definitions.definition: (of weather) Extremely cold.
In good health.
definitions.example: I had been sick, but now I'm well.

definitions.definition: Good, content.
definitions.example: “How are you?” — “I'm well, thank you!”

definitions.definition: Prudent; good; well-advised.
(manner) Accurately, competently, satisfactorily.
definitions.example: He does his job well.

definitions.definition: (manner) Completely, fully.
definitions.example: We’re well beat now.

definitions.definition: (degree) To a significant degree.
definitions.example: That author is well known.

definitions.definition: (degree) Very (as a general-purpose intensifier).
In a desirable manner; so as one could wish; satisfactorily; favourably; advantageously.
Used to acknowledge a statement or situation.
definitions.example: “I didn't like the music.” “Well, I thought it was good.”

definitions.definition: An exclamation of surprise (often doubled or tripled).
definitions.example: Well, well, well, what do we have here?

definitions.definition: An exclamation of indignance.
definitions.example: Well! There was no need to say that in front of my mother!

definitions.definition: Used in speech to express the overcoming of reluctance to say something.
definitions.example: It was a bit... well... too loud.

definitions.definition: Used in speech to fill gaps, particularly at the beginning of a response to a question; filled pause.
definitions.example: “So what have you been doing?” “Well, we went for a picnic, and then it started raining so we came home early.”

definitions.definition: (Hiberno-English) Used as a greeting
definitions.example: Well lads. How's things?

definitions.definition: A hole sunk into the ground as a source of water, oil, natural gas or other fluids.
A place where a liquid such as water surfaces naturally; a spring.
A small depression suitable for holding liquid or other objects.
definitions.example: Make a well in the dough mixture and pour in the milk.

definitions.definition: A source of supply.
A vertical, cylindrical trunk in a ship, reaching down to the lowest part of the hull, through which the bilge pumps operate.
The cockpit of a sailboat.

A compartment in the middle of the hold of a fishing vessel, made tight at the sides, but having holes perforated in the bottom to let in water to keep fish alive while they are transported to market.
A vertical passage in the stern into which an auxiliary screw propeller may be drawn up out of the water.
A hole or excavation in the earth, in mining, from which run branches or galleries.
An opening through the floors of a building, as for a staircase or an elevator; a wellhole.
The open space between the bench and the counsel tables in a courtroom.
The lower part of a furnace, into which the metal falls.
A well drink.
definitions.example: They're having a special tonight: $1 wells.

definitions.definition: The playfield of Tetris and similar video games, into which the blocks fall.
In a microtiter plate, each of the small equal circular or square sections which serve as test tubes.
To issue forth, as water from the earth; to flow; to spring.
To have something seep out of the surface.
definitions.example: Her eyes welled with tears.

definitions.definition: A person's life story, especially one published.
definitions.example: There are many biographies of Benjamin Franklin.

definitions.definition: The art of writing this kind of story.
To write a biography of.
Tune; sequence of notes that makes up a musical phrase
During the Middle Ages, a series of battles and other contests designed to prepare knights for war.
A series of games; either the same game played many times, or a succession of games related by a single theme; played competitively to determine a single winning team or individual.
A digraph obtained by assigning a direction to each edge in an undirected complete graph.
A miserable person; a wretch.
In a state of misery: very sad, ill, or poor.
Very bad (at something); unskilled, incompetent.
definitions.example: He's good at some sports, like tennis, but he's just miserable at football.

definitions.definition: Wretched; worthless; mean.
definitions.example: a miserable sinner

definitions.definition: Causing unhappiness or misery.
Avaricious; niggardly; miserly.
A place of worship for Muslims, often having at least one minaret; a masjid.
definitions.example: There's a mosque near where I live.

definitions.definition: The military installation from which troops are commanded and orders are issued; the military unit consisting of a commander and his support staff.
The center of an organization's operations or administration.
A place of concentrated activity or influence.
